brief_summary.textblock:
This single and multiple ascending dose study is the first evaluation of PF-0626414, a
      Selective Androgen Receptor Modulator in humans. The goal is to assess the safety,
      tolerability, pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics in healthy western and Japanese male
      subjects .

clinical_study.brief_title: Study To Evaluate Safety And Tolerability Of Single And Multiple Ascending Doses Of PF- 06260414 In Healthy Western And Japanese Male Subjects

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy male between the ages of 21 and 50 years, inclusive (Healthy is defined as no
             clinically relevant abnormalities identified by a detailed medical history, full
             physical examination, including blood pressure and pulse rate measurement, 12 lead
             ECG and clinical laboratory tests).

          -  Body Mass Index (BMI) of 17.5 to 30.5 kg/m2; and a total body weight >50 kg (110
             lbs).

          -  Additional inclusion criteria for subjects to be enrolled in Japanese cohort only:
             Japanese subjects who have four Japanese grandparents born in Japan.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Serum total testosterone level <270 or >1070 ng/dL

          -  Serum Prostate Specific Antigen (PSA) level >4 ng/mL.

          -  Hematocrit >48%.

          -  eGFR >150 ml/min/1.73m2.

intervention.description: Subjects will receive single doses of 1,3,10,30,100,200 mg of PF-06260414 (solution) in a dose escalating format
Subjects will receive single doses of PF-06260414 matching placebo (solution) in a dose escalation format
Subjects will receive PF-06260414 doses (solution) twice daily for 14 days
Subjects will receive PF-06260414 matching placebo doses (solution) twice daily for 14 days
Japanese subjects may receive the highest dose of PF-06460414 tested in non Japanese cohort twice daily for 14 days
Japanese subjects may receive PF-06260414 matching placebo doses (solution) twice daily for 14 days

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Double Blind (Sponsor Open), Placebo Controlled, Single-And Multiple Dose Escalation, Parallel Group Study To Evaluate The Safety,Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics And Pharmacodynamics Of PF- 06260414 In Healthy Western And Japanese Male Subjects

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline vital signs (blood pressure, pulse rate, oral temperature and respiration rate)
Changes from baseline in 12-lead ECG parameters
Incidence and severity of treatment emergent adverse events and withdrawals due to treatment emergent adverse events
Incidence and magnitude of treatment emergent clinical laboratory abnormalities including hematology (including total Hb and hematocrit), chemistry, fasting glucose, urinalysis
Changes from baseline in total testosterone, free testosterone, estradiol, LH, FSH, SHBG.
Changes from baseline in Prostate Specific Antigen (PSA).
Changes from baseline in total cholesterol, HDL cholesterol, LDL cholesterol, triglycerides.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Single Dose: Cmax, Tmax, AUClast, AUCinf, CL/F, Vz/F, and t½,Cmax(dn), AUCinf(dn), AUClast(dn), t½.
Multiple Dose: Cmax, Tmax Ctrough, C,av,AUC,CL/F, Vz/F, Rac , Rac,Cmax , PTR, Cmax(dn),AUCτ(dn), t½.
Urinary Pharmacokinetics: Amount of PF 06260414 excreted unchanged (AE and AE%), renal clearance (CLr).

secondary_outcome.description: The effects of PF- 06260414 on sex hormones (total testosterone, free testosterone, estradiol, SHBG, LH and FSH) will be evaluated according to the scheduled timepoints in single ascending dose study
secondary_outcome.measure: Single Dose: AUC(hormone or PSA), C0(hormone or PSA), Maximum PCB, Cmax(hormone or PSA), Cmin(hormone or PSA), Tmax(hormone or PSA), Tmin(hormone or PSA).
Multiple Dose: AUC(hormone or PSA), C0(hormone or PSA), Cmax(hormone or PSA), Cmin(hormone or PSA), Tmax(hormone or PSA), Tmin(hormone or PSA).

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
